{"step_by_step_thinking": "The question is asking whether cardenolides inhibit Na+/K+ ATPase. From the documents provided, we can find relevant information about cardenolides and their relationship to Na+/K+ ATPase. In the document 'Inhibition of beef-brain and dog-heart (Na+ + k+) activated adenosine triphosphatase by carbon-3 branched cardenolides', it is mentioned that 22 C-3 branched cardenolides were investigated as inhibitors of Na+/K+ ATPase. The synthetic compounds had lower inhibitory strength than digitoxigenin, and there was no indication of an improved safety index. This suggests that cardenolides can inhibit Na+/K+ ATPase, but the extent of inhibition may vary depending on the specific compound.
